title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restrictive
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Restrictive 

Measures concerning Somalia) (No.3) Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (restrictive measure concerning somalia) (no.3) regulation 2024

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations - 

“Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003” means Council Regulation (EC) No. 
147/2003 of 27 January 20031 as amended by the European acts specified in Part 
1 of Schedule 1; 

“Council Regulation (EU) No. 356/2010” means Council Regulation (EU) No. 
356/2010 of 26 April 20102 as amended by the European acts specified in Part 
2 of Schedule 1; 

“Council Regulations” means Council Regulation (EU) No. 147/2003 and 
Council Regulation (EU) No. 356/2010; 

 “European act” means an act adopted by an institution of the European Union 
or an institution of the European Communities. 

(2) A word or expression which is used in these Regulations and which is 
also used in the Council Regulations has, unless the context otherwise requires, 
the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulations.
text_norm: 2 (1) regulation - council regulation (ec) no 147 2003 mean council regulation (ec) no 147 2003 27 january 20031 amended european act specified part 1 schedule 1 council regulation (eu) no 356 2010 mean council regulation (eu) no 356 2010 26 april 20102 amended european act specified part 2 schedule 1 council regulation mean council regulation (eu) no 147 2003 council regulation (eu) no 356 2010 european act mean act adopted institution european union institution european community (2) word expression used regulation also used council regulation unless context otherwise requires meaning regulation council regulation

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of -
text_raw:
3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of - 

(a) 

(b) 

 Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 specified in paragraph 1 
of Schedule 2, or 

 Council Regulation (EU) No. 356/2010 specified in paragraph 2 
of Schedule 2, 

shall be guilty of an offence. 

(2) A person who contravenes a condition of an authorisation granted under 

a provision of the Council Regulations shall be guilty of an offence. 

1 OJ No. L 24, 29.1.2003, p. 2 
2 OJ No. L 105, 27.4.2010, p. 1 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 8th October, 2024.

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable -
text_raw:
4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable - 

(a) 

on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for 
a term not exceeding 12 months or both, or 

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or 
to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.
text_norm: 4 person guilty offence regulation 3 shall liable - (a) summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 12 month (b) conviction indictment fine exceeding eur500 000 imprisonment term exceeding 3 year both

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 5. A competent authority in the State, following such consultation as it
text_raw:
5. A competent authority in the State, following such consultation as it 
considers necessary with other competent authorities, for the purposes of the 
administration and enforcement of the Council Regulations or these Regulations, 
may give in writing such directions to a person as it sees fit.
text_norm: 5 competent authority state following consultation considers necessary competent authority purpose administration enforcement council regulation regulation may give writing direction person see fit

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 6. A person who fails to comply with a direction given under Regulation 5
text_raw:
6. A person who fails to comply with a direction given under Regulation 5 
within the time specified in the direction shall be guilty of an offence and shall 
be liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term 
not exceeding 6 months or both.
text_norm: 6 person fails comply direction given regulation 5 within time specified direction shall guilty offence shall liable summary conviction class fine imprisonment term exceeding 6 month both

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 7. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body
text_raw:
7. Where an offence under these Regulations is committed by a body 
corporate and is proved to have been so committed with the consent or 
connivance of or to be attributable to any neglect on the part of any person, being 
a director, manager, secretary or other officer of the body corporate, or a person 
who was purporting to act in such capacity, that person shall, as well as the body 
corporate, be guilty of an offence and shall be liable to be proceeded against and 
punished as if he or she were guilty of the first-mentioned offence.
text_norm: 7 offence regulation committed body corporate proved committed consent connivance attributable neglect part person director manager secretary officer body corporate person purporting act capacity person shall well body corporate guilty offence shall liable proceeded punished guilty first-mentioned offence

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: 8. (1) Proceedings for an offence under these Regulations in relation to an
text_raw:
8. (1) Proceedings for an offence under these Regulations in relation to an 
act committed outside the State may be taken in any place in the State and the 
offence may for all incidental purposes be treated as having been committed in 
that place. 

(2) Where a person is charged with an offence referred to in paragraph (1), 
no further proceedings in the matter (other than any remand in custody or on 
bail) may be taken except by or with the consent of the Director of Public 
Prosecutions. 

(3) In proceedings for an offence referred to in paragraph (1), 

(a) 

(b) 

a certificate purporting to be signed by an officer of the 
Department of Foreign Affairs and stating that a passport was 
issued by that Department to a person on a specified date, and 

a certificate that is signed by an officer of the Minister for Justice 
and stating that, to the best of the officer’s knowledge and belief, 
the person has not ceased to be an Irish citizen, is evidence that 
the person was an Irish citizen on the date on which the offence 
is alleged to have been committed, and is taken to have been 
signed by the person purporting to have signed it, unless the 
contrary is shown. 

 
 
 
 
 
 4 [513] 

(4) A person who has been acquitted or convicted of an offence in a place 
outside the State shall not be proceeded against for an offence under these 
Regulations in relation to an act committed outside the State consisting of the 
conduct, or substantially the same conduct, that constituted the offence of which 
the person has been acquitted or convicted.

title: for the purpose of giving full effect to Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide for the enforcement of restrictive measures contained 
in Council Regulation (EC) No. 147/2003 as amended and Council Regulation 
(EU) No. 356/2010 as amended, regarding restrictive measures concerning 
Somalia. 

The Regulations provide that competent authorities of the State may issue 
directions for the purpose of giving full effect to the sanctions. 

The Regulations create offences for breach of the Council Regulations or for 
failure to comply with the directions of competent authorities of the State with 
regard to implementation of the sanctions and provides for appropriate penalties. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 10 [513]
